uk_grocery_table.template: SELECT id as id, store_name, retailer, fascia, size_sqft FROM ${table} WHERE true ${viewport} ${filter} limit 99;

retail_points.name: Retail Points
retail_points.meta:
Major Supermarket and Convenience Store Locations across the UK.


Documentation


Open Data - Download for Free

LAD.groupmeta:
The UK’s administrative boundaries in a consistent package. The geographics include hybrid zone, output area, lower super output area, local authority district, county, region, country. The core framework which all national statistics are published within.


Documentation


Contact Us

education.title: Education
education.groupmeta:
Spatial dataset of all early year locations, schools, colleges and further education establishments. All primary and secondary schools both private and state. Includes school roll data, ofsted results and pupil demographics.

All University buildings (academic, service, residential and campus boundary) & entrances digitised and attributed, with student counts.


Documentation


Contact Us

grocery_demand.name: Grocery Demand
grocery_demand.meta:
Weekly spend on grocery at output area. Also split into main, convenience, kiosk and online. This can help identify how consumers spend within the grocery retail in an area and support retailers with the driving business in each of these channels.


Documentation


Contact Us

food_to_go.name: Food To Go Demand
food_to_go.meta:
Average weekly spend on Food To Go (FTG) at Hybrid Zone by year forecasted 5 years. FTG is based mainly around shopping and worker patterns and a tertiary residential element. Hybrid Zones (HZ) are a combination of OA and WZ based on whether it’s a worker or residential area.


Documentation


Contact Us

poi.name: Points of Interest
poi.meta:
A collection of points of interest across the UK including healthcare locations, law and order sites along with sport & leisure facilities, stadia, cinemas and service areas. Displays key features in an area, popularly used on property portals, allocating and routing of healthcare resources to vital locations and analysing law and order provisions.


Documentation


Contact Us

postal_sector.name: Postal Sector
postal_sector.groupmeta:
Manually created postal boundaries at sector, district and area level, combining exceptional ‘enclosure’ accuracy with borders that follow real-world features. A key geography used within customer insight and marketing teams. An alternative reporting and display geography. Download the 2012 postal sector boundaries released under the same terms as the OS Open Data license with the single addition of GEOLYTIX to the attribution list.


Documentation


Contact Us

Open Data - download for free

rail_lines.name: Rail Lines
rail_lines.groupmeta:
100% Transport locations including airports, bus stops, rail, underground, light rail stations and lines plus passenger counts where available. Perfect for accessibility studies and modelling on-street pedestrian volume.


Documentation


Contact Us

retail_places.name: Retail Places
retail_places.groupmeta:
More than 20k scored, profiled and named polygons detailing where people shop in the UK. Ideal for locating new sites and understanding micro location performance.

Additionally Retail Pitch can be purchased along side this pack which identifies hotspots across 2,000 Retail Places which can aid in portfolio rationalisation.


Documentation


Contact Us

Open Data - download for free

theme.title: Retail pitch rank in decimal scale
theme.label: Retail pitch rank in decimal scale

road_traffic.name: Road Traffic
road_traffic.meta:
Modelled traffic count for all major roads in the UK. Over 185,000 roads with an annual average daily flow.


Documentation


Contact Us

seamless_towns.name: Seamless towns and suburbs
seamless_towns.meta:
100% Seamless UK definitions of natural markets at 4 levels, local, towns, district and region. Close match to true ‘markets’ at multiple scales.


Documentation


Contact Us

town_suburb.name: Town and suburb
town_suburb.meta:
A precise and intuitive set of 30,000 named ‘places’ across the UK richly attributed with data. Ideal base for UK wide profiling and benchmarking.


Documentation


Contact Us

Urbanity.meta:
Output areas assigned with an urbanity (1-9), ranging from major centre to ultra rural. Helpful to know how urban/rural somewhere is which will affect how people shop and influence the type of retail offer (convenience vs supermarket) that should be favoured.


Documentation


Contact Us

Workers.meta:
Up to date worker counts for more than 400,000 commercial postcodes across the UK. Worker counts, densities and occupation splits at hybrid zone level.


Documentation


Contact Us
